text: Imma xanthomela is a moth of the family Immidae. It is found on Sulawesi. The wingspan is about 19 mm. The forewings are blackish, with the extreme costal edge yellow on the basal half and orange-yellow subcostal and submedian streaks from near the base to two-fifths, the lower rather broad. There is a large transverse orange-yellow blotch in the lower part of the disc beyond the middle, connected with the middle of the costa by a streak from the anterior angle. The hindwings are blackish, with an elongate orange-yellow spot in the disc, pointed anteriorly.Exotic Microlep. 4: 3 ==References== Category:Immidae Category:Moths described in 1930 Category:Moths of Indonesia Category:Taxa named by Edward Meyrick
title: Imma xanthomela
